p: T nw is the natural wet bulb temperature (measured with a wet wick thermometer exposed to the local air movement and radiation), T g is the temperature in the centre of a 150Â mm diameter black globe, T a is the air temperature shielded from radiation, but not restricted for air circulation around the sensor. Although wind speed is not directly measured and included in the above equations, T nw and T g combines the effects of radiation, humidity, air temperature and wind (Havenith and Fiala 2016).
